title: Ticket #4656: Cannot create Daemon object with only 'Name'.
description:
The Daemon object constructor does not work when only being given a Daemon's name.

Example code: 

Daemon remote_cached(DT_GENERIC, remote_daemon_name.c_str());

When calling locate() on this daemon, you get the error: 

Unable to get daemon information because no subsystem specified

I have gotten around this problem by querying the collector for the full classad of the daemon and using that to initialize the daemon object, with DT_GENERIC. This method works correctly, but I feel this should be supported in the daemon object.
